S. Korean troops commit military provocation 
    Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- South Korean troops yesterday committed a military provocation by introducing two combat armoured cars into the demilitarized zone of the military demarcation line, according to military sources. 
 The provocation by the South Korean military who were clamouring about "their observance of the armistice agreement" proves their bellicosity and impudence.
 They are persistently putting a brake on the implementation of the June 15 north-south joint declaration. They should stop a rash act, mindful of grave consequences of the military provocation.

Friendly city relations established between Pyongyang and Kathmandu 
    Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A protocol on establishing the friendly city relations between Pyongyang and Kathmandu was signed in the building of the Kathmandu city office on November 21.
 At the signing ceremony the mayor of Kathmandu said that he would make positive efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with Pyongyang and the DPRK in different fields and learn from the precious achievements and experience gained by the Korean people.

articles.content:
Greetings to Mauritanian President
    Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Mauritanian President Maaouiya Ould Sid Ahmed Taya on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of independence.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president and, through him, to the government and people of Mauritania on this occasion and wished the Mauritanian President and people a great success in their work to achieve the independent development and prosperity of the country as well as the president good health and happiness.
